title: Scans of 400 years old books online somewhere?
content:
Hello,   
   
it's now half a year that **I am searching for a website that was offering high quality scans (300 DPI) of some really old books** (from the 14th to 19th century I think).   
   
As far as I remember it was in italian or spanish, a kind of an online exhibition of a museum or a foundation. There were italian, spanish, french, german and english books. Per book there were at least 3 scans. Mostly one of the title page, some illustrations and the colophon.   
   
And I tell you, the illustrations in those books were more than fantastic! As I first saw it I was thinking "now that's for sure the best way to study old faces online".   
   
**Now, can somebody help me out with the URL?** (I've lost it due to a hard drive crash..)   
   
The only thing that comes close to it is [http://wally.rit.edu/cary/cc\_db/subject\_library.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060522152747/http:/wally.rit.edu/cary/cc_db/subject_library.html) but it is still miles away of the material offered on the other website.   
   
Thank you,   
Roman Schechtel   
(for german readers: [http://www.designmadeingermany.de/forum.php4?thread\_ID=3549](http://web.archive.org/web/20060522152747/http:/www.designmadeingermany.de/forum.php4?thread_ID=3549) )
author: romanschechtel
